com.mindfusion.scheduling.model

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Appointment

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents events scheduled to occur at some point in time. It is derived by concrete classes such as Appointment.

      Initializes a new instance of the Item class.

      • clone

        public abstract Item clone()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Creates a clone of this item.

        The clone of a recurring item is not an occurrence but an ordinary item. Aside from this, the clone is an exact duplicate of the original item.

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A reference to the newly created item.

      • createState

        protected ItemState createState()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Creates an item state corresponding to the concrete type of this item.

        This method is used by the undo/redo system to create an ItemState-derived object that corresponds to the item class. Custom item classes must override Item.createState() in order to implement undo/redo support for any additional members they define. This method should be overridden together with Item.saveState() and Item.restoreState(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ItemState).

        Returns:
        An instance of ItemState or a derived class.

      • saveState

        protected ItemState saveState()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Saves the state of this item.

        This method is used by the undo/redo system to save the state of an item. Custom item classes must override Item.saveState() in order to implement undo/redo support for any additional members they define. This method should be overridden together with Item.createState() and Item.restoreState(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ItemState).

        Returns:
        An ItemState that represents the current state of the item.

      • restoreState

        protected void restoreState(ItemState state)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Restores the state of this item.

        This method is used by the undo/redo system to restore an item to a previous state. Custom item classes must override Item.restoreState(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.ItemState) in order to implement undo/redo support for any additional members they define. This method should be overridden together with Item.createState() and Item.saveState().

        Parameters:
        state - An ItemState that represents previous state of the item.

      • saveTo

        public void saveTo(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                   XmlSerializationContext context)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Saves the item data to an XML document.
        Parameters:
        element - Allows adding data to the XML document.
        context - The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the XML document.

      • loadFrom

        public void loadFrom(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                     XmlSerializationContext context)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Loads item data from an XML document.
        Parameters:
        element - Allows reading data from the XML document.
        context - The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the XML document.

      • copyOccurrence

        protected void copyOccurrence(Item master)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Called by the recurrence whenever a new occurrence is being generated in order to populate the fields of the instance from the master item.

        This method is usually overridden in classes which derive from Item or Appointment in order to copy the custom fields from the master item to a particular occurrence. If the method is not overridden, the custom fields for all occurrences will have their default values and not the value of the master item.

        Parameters:
        master - A reference to the master to copy from.

      • onVisualsChanged

        protected void onVisualsChanged()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Forces the item to be repainted.

        Call this method from within your derived classes when the appearance of the item has been changed.

      • getStartTime

        public abstract DateTime getStartTime()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the item's scheduled start time.

        This property affects the initial time cell occupied by the item when it is displayed in a Calendar component.

        Returns:
        A DateTime instance specifying the scheduled time for the item.

      • getAllDayEvent

        public abstract boolean getAllDayEvent()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets a value indicating whether the item represents an all day event.

        All day event items are displayed in a special header area when the Calendar displays a timetable view.

        Returns:
        true if the item is an all day event; otherwise, false.

        public abstract java.lang.String getDescriptionText()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the description displayed for this item by scheduling controls.

        All classes that derive from Item must implement this property. Components such as Calendar display this text in the details area of an item visual representation.

        Returns:
        A string containing the description of this item.

        Description copied from class: Item

      • setLocked

      • getReminder

        public abstract Reminder getReminder()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the reminder for this item.

        If the reminder type is Exact, the itemReminderTriggered event is raised at the time set in the reminder's Time property. If the reminder type is Leading, the itemReminderTriggered event is raised certain amount of time prior to the item's StartTime, as specified in the reminder's TimeInterval property.

        Note: Recurring items cannot have leading reminders.

        Returns:
        An instance of the Reminder class.

      • setReminder

        public abstract void setReminder(Reminder value)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Sets the reminder for this item.

        If the reminder type is Exact, the itemReminderTriggered event is raised at the time set in the reminder's Time property. If the reminder type is Leading, the itemReminderTriggered event is raised certain amount of time prior to the item's StartTime, as specified in the reminder's TimeInterval property.

        Note: Recurring items cannot have leading reminders.

        Parameters:
        value - An instance of the Reminder class.

      • getRecurrence

        public Recurrence getRecurrence()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the recurrence pattern of this item.

        If this property is set, the item becomes a recurring event and the Calendar component displays multiple occurrences of the item. To detach a previously set recurrence from an item, set this property to null.

        Returns:
        An instance of the Recurrence class. The default is null.

      • setRecurrence

        public void setRecurrence(Recurrence value)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Sets the recurrence pattern of this item.

        If this property is set, the item becomes a recurring event and the Calendar component displays multiple occurrences of the item. To detach a previously set recurrence from an item, set this property to null.

        Parameters:
        value - An instance of the Recurrence class. The default is null.

      • getRecurrenceState

        public RecurrenceState getRecurrenceState()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the recurrence state of this item.

        Events raised by the Calendar component could pass as an argument an occurrence or an exception of a recurring item. This property lets you determine the exact state of the item's recurrence state.

        Returns:
        One of the RecurrenceState constants.

      • getOccurrenceIndex

        public int getOccurrenceIndex()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the index of a repeating occurrence of a recurring item.
        Returns:
        An integer value identifying the index of an occurrence item within the recurrence array. If the item is not recurring, this property returns -1.

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the priority of this item.

        Items with higher priority have a better chance to be displayed prior items with lower priority. If two items start and end at the same time, the item with higher Priority will be displayed before the item with lower Priority. In other words, this property gives you control over the order of the items.

        Returns:
        An integer value, specifying the item's priority.

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(int value)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Sets the priority of this item.

        Items with higher priority have a better chance to be displayed prior items with lower priority. If two items start and end at the same time, the item with higher Priority will be displayed before the item with lower Priority. In other words, this property gives you control over the order of the items.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value, specifying the item's priority.

      • getStyle

        public abstract Style getStyle()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets a style associated with the item.

        This style is applied to the item when it is neither pointed with the mouse nor selected.

        Returns:
        A Style object that defines the appearance of the item.

      • getPointedStyle

        public abstract Style getPointedStyle()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the style associated with the item.

        This style is applied to the item when it is pointed with the mouse. This property is ignored and Style is used instead of it when UseExtendedStyles is set to false.

        Returns:
        A Style object that defines the appearance of the appointment.

      • getPointedSelectedStyle

        public abstract Style getPointedSelectedStyle()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets the style associated with the item.

        This style is applied to the item when it is pointed with the mouse and selected at the same time. This property is ignored and SelectedStyle is used instead of it when UseExtendedStyles is set to false.

        Returns:
        An instance of the Style class that defines the appearance of the item.

      • setPointedSelectedStyle

      • getVisible

        public abstract boolean getVisible()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Gets a flag indicating whether the item is visible or not.

        Invisible items are not drawn at all. You could use this property to hide an item temporarily, or to store additional data in a helper item object that always stays invisible.

        Returns:
        true if the item is visible; otherwise, false. The default is true.

      • setVisible

        public abstract void setVisible(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Item
        Sets a flag indicating whether the item is visible or not.

        Invisible items are not drawn at all. You could use this property to hide an item temporarily, or to store additional data in a helper item object that always stays invisible.

        Parameters:
        value - true if the item is visible; otherwise, false. The default is true.
